verses.roman:
tad viśva-nābhiṁ tv ativartya viṣṇor
aṇīyasā virajenātmanaikaḥ
namaskṛtaṁ brahma-vidām upaiti
kalpāyuṣo yad vibudhā ramante

synonyms: tat—that; viśva-nābhim—navel of the universal Personality of Godhead; tu—but; ativartya—crossing over; viṣṇoḥ—of Lord Viṣṇu, the Personality of Godhead; aṇīyasā—due to mystic perfection; virajena—by the purified; ātmanā—by the living entity; ekaḥ—alone; namaskṛtam—worshipable; brahma-vidām—by those who are transcendentally situated; upaiti—reaches; kalpa-āyuṣaḥ—a period of 4,300,000,000 solar years; yat—the place; vibudhāḥ—self-realized souls; ramante—do enjoy.
translation: This Śiśumāra is the pivot for the turning of the complete universe, and it is called the navel of Viṣṇu [Garbhodakaśāyī Viṣṇu]. The yogī alone goes beyond this circle of Śiśumāra and attains the planet [Maharloka] where purified saints like Bhṛgu enjoy a duration of life of 4,300,000,000 solar years. This planet is worshipable even for the saints who are transcendentally situated.
